thread.title: 3 female journalists stopped from entering Jags locker room
thread.title_full: 3 female journalists stopped from entering Jags locker room - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: 3 female journalists stopped from entering Jags locker room
text:
Photo: Michael Conroy, AP Image 1 of / 1   1 Jacksonville Jaguars' Jason Myers (2) watches as he misses a potential game winning field goal as Indianapolis Colts' Josh Thomas (35) reacts late in the second half of an NFL football game Sunday, Oct. 4, 2015, in Indianapolis.
Photo: Michael Conroy, AP Jacksonville Jaguars' Jason Myers (2) watches as he misses a... 3 female journalists stopped from entering Jags locker room 1  /  1 Back to Gallery INDIANAPOLIS (AP) â€” A male usher stopped three female journalists from entering the Jaguars locker room after their loss to the Colts because they were women, asking other men if it was OK before finally allowing them inside.
Graham Watson of Yahoo Sports and Joey Chandler of the Tuscaloosa News both said on Twitter on Sunday night that they were not allowed inside the locker room after Indianapolis' 16-13 overtime win until the usher first checked to make sure the women were allowed to enter. The women were at the game as part of the Associated Press Sports Editors sports media diversity weekend.
Public relations staffs from both the Colts and the Jaguars apologized to the women.
Colts spokesman Avis Roper tells The Associated Press the usher was in an area where he didn't know who was allowed access.
The Association for Women in Sports Media says it's unfortunate that such issues continue to exist.
___
